noun.description: A sound or series of sounds caused by the reflection of sound waves from a surface back to the listener.
examples: the walls threw back the echoes of his footsteps

noun.description: A close parallel or repetition of an idea, feeling, style, or event.
examples: his love for her found an echo in her own feelings

noun.description: A person who slavishly repeats the words or opinions of another.
A play by a defender of a higher card in a suit followed by a lower one in a subsequent trick, used as a signal to request a further lead of that suit by their partner.
A code word representing the letter E, used in radio communication.

verb.description: (of a sound) be repeated or reverberate after the original sound has stopped.
examples: their footsteps echoed on the metal catwalks

verb.description: (of an object, movement, or event) be reminiscent of or have shared characteristics with.
examples: a blue suit that echoed the color of her eyes

verb.description: Send a copy of (an input signal or character) back to its source or to a screen for display.
examples: for security reasons, the password will not be echoed to the screen

verb.description: (of a defender) play a higher card followed by a lower one in the same suit, as a signal to request one's partner to lead that suit.

proper noun.description: A nymph deprived of speech by Hera in order to stop her chatter, and left able only to repeat what others had said.

origin: Middle English: from Old French or Latin, from Greek ēkhō, related to ēkhē a sound.
